Let's break down the foundation of restaurant staff and operations from scratch.

Core Restaurant Staff Roles
Front of House (FOH)

Host/Hostess â€” greets guests, manages reservations, assigns tables, tracks wait times
Waiters/Servers â€” takes orders, serves food, handles customer requests, processes payments
Busser â€” clears tables, resets for next guests, assists servers
Bartender â€” prepares drinks, manages bar area
Cashier â€” handles billing, sometimes doubles as host in smaller places
Back of House (BOH)

Head Chef / Executive Chef â€” menu planning, kitchen management, quality control
Line Cooks â€” prepare specific stations (grill, fry, salad, etc.)
Prep Cook â€” chops vegetables, prepares ingredients before service
Dishwasher â€” cleans dishes, utensils, keeps kitchen sanitary
Kitchen Manager â€” inventory, ordering supplies, staff scheduling
Management

Restaurant Manager/Owner â€” overall operations, hiring, financials, customer issues
Floor Manager â€” supervises FOH during service
Inventory Manager â€” tracks stock, manages suppliers
Typical Workflow: What Happens When a Customer Walks In?
Arrival â†’ Host checks availability, assigns table or adds to waitlist
Seating â†’ Guest seated, menu provided
Ordering â†’ Waiter takes order (drinks first, then food)
Kitchen receives order â†’ Ticket printed or displayed, cooks begin preparation
Food prepared â†’ Line cooks coordinate timing so dishes come out together
Food served â†’ Waiter delivers, checks if anything else needed
During meal â†’ Waiter checks back, refills drinks, handles requests
Bill requested â†’ Waiter brings check
Payment â†’ Cash or card processed
Table cleared â†’ Busser resets table for next guest
What are the pain points you've noticed or want to explore next? For example: order mistakes, kitchen delays, table turnover, payment bottlenecks, communication gaps between FOH and BOH?

Phase 1: Customer Arrival & Seating (Refined)
Two Ways to Start a Session
Option A: Host Marks Table Occupied

Traditional flow â€” host seats guest, taps "occupied" on dashboard
Works for reservations, guided seating, busy nights with waitlist
Option B: Guest Scans QR â†’ Auto-Occupies Table

Self-service flow â€” guest walks in, finds empty table, scans QR
System detects scan â†’ marks table as occupied
No host needed for this interaction
This gives flexibility â€” works for both full-service restaurants and casual/fast-casual setups.

Immediate Notification: Water Service
The moment a table becomes occupied, the assigned waiter should know.

Trigger	Notification To	Message
Table marked occupied (by host or QR scan)	Assigned Waiter	"Table 5 now seated â€” serve water"
Why water first?

Universal hospitality gesture
Gives waiter a reason to approach, make eye contact, welcome guest
Buys time for customer to browse menu on QR

Absolutely right. Time tracking is everything in hospitality â€” it measures service quality, identifies bottlenecks, and holds staff accountable.

Timestamp Philosophy: Every Action Has a Time
In restaurants, time directly impacts:

Customer satisfaction â€” waiting too long = bad reviews
Table turnover â€” faster service = more revenue
Staff performance â€” who's fast, who's slow
Kitchen efficiency â€” how long from order to plate
Operational insights â€” peak hours, slow periods, average dining duration
Phase 1 Timestamps: Seating
Event	Timestamp Field	Why It Matters
Table marked occupied	seated_at	Session start, baseline for all measurements
Waiter notified	waiter_notified_at	Track notification delivery
Waiter acknowledged	waiter_acknowledged_at	Did waiter see the alert?
Water served	water_served_at	First service touchpoint
Calculated Metrics:

waiter_response_time = waiter_acknowledged_at - waiter_notified_at
water_service_time = water_served_at - seated_at
Full Session Timestamps (Preview)
Here's what a complete dining session could track:

Key Metrics You Can Calculate
Customer Experience:

Total dining time = vacated_at - seated_at
Wait for first service = water_served_at - seated_at
Order to food time = food_served_at - order_placed_at
Bill wait time = bill_delivered_at - bill_requested_at
Staff Performance:

Waiter response time (per call type)
Average tables handled per shift
Acknowledgment rate (did they see notifications?)
Kitchen Performance:

Prep time per dish = order_ready_at - preparation_started_at
Queue time = preparation_started_at - kitchen_received_at
Operations:

Table turnover time = table_ready_at - vacated_at
Average session duration by table size
Peak hours analysis
Escalation Based on Time
Timestamps enable automatic escalation:

Condition	Action
Waiter not acknowledged within 2 min	Alert floor manager
Water not served within 5 min of seating	Escalate to manager
Food not served within 10 min of ready	Alert manager, flag kitchen delay
Bill not delivered within 3 min of request	Escalate
Table not cleaned within 5 min of vacate	Alert cleaning supervisor
These thresholds should be configurable per restaurant â€” fine dining has different expectations than fast casual.

Why "Picked Up" + "Served" Separately?
Two timestamps reveal:

Metric	Calculation	Why It Matters
Kitchen wait time	food_picked_at - order_ready_at	Food sitting = getting cold
Delivery time	food_served_at - food_picked_at	Waiter speed to table
If food waits 10 min at kitchen pass â€” problem is waiter.
If waiter picks up instantly but serves 5 min later â€” maybe got distracted.

Condition	Alert To	Message
Order not started in 5 min	Kitchen Manager	"Order #1247 waiting to start"
Food ready, not picked in 3 min	Floor Manager	"Food getting cold â€” Table 5"
Food picked, not served in 2 min	Floor Manager	"Where is Table 5 food?"

Timestamps for Billing
Event	Timestamp	Trigger
Bill requested	bill_requested_at	Guest taps "Request Bill"
Bill printed	bill_printed_at	Waiter/Cashier taps "Print"
Bill delivered	bill_delivered_at	Waiter taps "Bill Delivered"
Payment completed	payment_completed_at	Waiter confirms or system auto-confirms
Metrics
Metric	Calculation
Bill wait time	bill_delivered_at - bill_requested_at
Payment time	payment_completed_at - bill_delivered_at
Total checkout time	payment_completed_at - bill_requested_at
Escalation
Condition	Action
Bill not printed in 2 min	Alert cashier + manager
Bill not delivered in 3 min	Alert manager
Payment pending for 10 min	Alert waiter (guest may have questions)

Marks session as "Payment Complete"
Table status changes to "Vacating" or "Needs Cleaning"

Payment Data Structure
Payment {
  id
  session_id
  bill_total

  // Multiple payment entries
  payment_parts: [
    {
      method: "cash"
      amount: 100
      collected_at: timestamp
      collected_by: waiter_id
    },
    {
      method: "card"
      amount: 400
      collected_at: timestamp
      collected_by: waiter_id
      transaction_id: "TXN123" (if online/card)
    }
  ]

  // Timestamps
  bill_requested_at
  bill_printed_at
  bill_delivered_at
  payment_completed_at
}
Timestamps for Partial Payment
Event	Timestamp	Trigger
Bill requested	bill_requested_at	Guest taps "Request Bill"
Bill printed	bill_printed_at	Staff prints
Bill delivered	bill_delivered_at	Waiter delivers
Each part collected	part.collected_at	Waiter marks each payment
All payments done	payment_completed_at	System marks when remaining = 0
Edge Cases
Situation	Handling
Guest changes mind on payment method	Can edit/remove before waiter collects
Guest adds online payment but doesn't pay	Waiter waits or switches to cash/card
Total doesn't match	System prevents â€” remaining must be Rs. 0
Guest wants to add tip	Optional tip field before confirming

Your idea is excellent. This is called smart order sequencing â€” kitchen manages multiple tables intelligently so:

Big orders don't come all at once (food gets cold)
Small orders don't wait behind big orders (unfair delay)
Food quality stays high (served at right temperature)
The Problem You Identified
Without Smart Sequencing
3:00 PM â€” Table 1 orders 10 items
3:10 PM â€” Table 2 orders 1 item

Kitchen works on Table 1 first (10 items)...
3:25 PM â€” Table 1 gets all 10 items at once
          â†’ Some items cold, too much food at once

3:30 PM â€” Table 2 finally gets 1 item
          â†’ Waited 20 min for 1 simple dish!
Bad experience for everyone.

With Smart Sequencing
3:00 PM â€” Table 1 orders 10 items
3:10 PM â€” Table 2 orders 1 item

Kitchen thinks smartly:
- Start Table 1 batch 1 (3 items)
- Start Table 2 (1 item) â€” quick, don't make them wait
- Continue Table 1 batch 2 (3 items)
- Continue Table 1 batch 3 (4 items)

3:12 PM â€” Table 2 gets their 1 item âœ“ (only 2 min wait!)
3:15 PM â€” Table 1 gets first 3 items (hot, fresh)
3:22 PM â€” Table 1 gets next 3 items (hot, fresh)
3:30 PM â€” Table 1 gets last 4 items (hot, fresh)
Good experience for everyone.

Batching Rules (Configurable)
Setting	Default	Meaning
Max items per batch	4	Don't serve more than 4 items at once
Quick item threshold	5 min	Items under 5 min prep = priority eligible
Priority jump limit	1 order	Only let 1 small order jump per big order
Batch gap time	8-10 min	Time between batches for same table
Restaurant owner can adjust these in settings.

Event	Timestamp

Priority order wait time	Are small orders being handled fast
Food temperature score	Time from ready to served (shorter = hotter)
Large order satisfaction	Feedback from big orders

  has_pending_items      // any items not yet served?

  // Serve tracking
  first_food_served_at   // first food item served (not drinks)
  last_food_served_at    // most recent food served

  // Calculated
  is_first_order         // true if no food served yet in session
  waiting_since          // how long since order with no serve
}
Kitchen Alert Rules
Condition	Alert
Ordered 10+ min ago, no food served	ğŸ”´ URGENT flash on screen
Ordered 15+ min ago, no food served	Alert kitchen manager
First order of session waiting 8+ min	Priority boost
Summary
Kitchen sees context, not just orders:

What They See	Why It Matters
Ordered X min ago	How long they've been waiting
Served Y min ago	Did they get any food yet?
No food yet	First order â€” hungry guest, prioritize
Served recently	They have food, less urgent
No pending order	Just eating, no action needed
This helps kitchen make smart decisions about what to cook next.

Performance metrics	Improve kitchen efficiency

Data Structure
MenuItem {
  id
  name
  price
  category

  // Availability
  is_available: true/false

  // Timestamps
  unavailable_at: timestamp (when marked)
  unavailable_by: staff_id (who marked)
  available_at: timestamp (when restored)
}

RestaurantSettings {
  unavailable_display: "show" | "hide"
}

Guest	Sees based on setting
Staff	Always sees full menu with status

Bar Display
Similar to kitchen but for drinks â€” beer, cocktails, mocktails, soft drinks, etc.

Bar vs Kitchen â€” Key Differences
Aspect	Kitchen	Bar
Items	Food	Drinks
Prep time	5-20 min	1-5 min
Batching	Often needed	Rarely needed
Coordination	Wait for all items	Usually serve immediately
Stations	Multiple (grill, wok, etc.)	Usually single or few
Drinks are faster â€” bar display is simpler but still needs context.

Drink Categories
Category	Examples
Soft Drinks	Coke, Sprite, Juice
Hot Beverages	Tea, Coffee
Mocktails	Virgin Mojito, Fruit Punch
Cocktails	Mojito, Margarita, Whiskey Sour
Beer	Draft, Bottled
Wine	Red, White, By glass/bottle
Spirits	Whiskey, Rum, Vodka (neat/on rocks)

Jan 23
Waiter Dashboard
Waiter is the central connection between guest, kitchen, and bar. Their dashboard must show everything they need in one place.

Waiter Responsibilities
Task	What They Do
Water service	Serve water when guest seated
Order assistance	Help if guest has questions
Food pickup	Collect from kitchen, deliver to table
Drink pickup	Collect from bar, deliver to table
Assistance response	Respond to guest calls
Bill delivery	Bring bill when requested
Payment collection	Collect cash/card payment

Condition 2: Table Merge (Connect Tables)
10 guests arrive, but largest table has 5 capacity. Merge Table 1 + Table 2 together.

Why This Happens
Large party (birthday, office lunch, family gathering)
No single table big enough
Adjacent tables can be physically combined

Auto merge after Cleaning

Jan 23
Smart. After cleaning, merged tables should automatically separate back to individual tables.

Auto Unmerge After Cleaning
Current Flow (Manual Unmerge)
Party leaves â†’ Payment complete â†’ Tables need cleaning â†’
Cleaning done â†’ Staff manually unmerges â†’ Tables ready
Problem: Staff might forget to unmerge. Tables stay merged unnecessarily.

New Flow (Auto Unmerge)
Party leaves â†’ Payment complete â†’ Tables need cleaning â†’
Cleaning done â†’ System auto-unmerges â†’ Tables ready individually
Better: No manual step. Tables automatically available as separate units.

Activity Log Entry â€” Data Structure
ActivityLog {
  id
  timestamp: datetime (precise to second)

  // What happened
  activity_type: string
  activity_category: "seating" | "order" | "kitchen" | "bar" |
                     "waiter" | "billing" | "manager" | "staff" | "issue"

  // Where
  table_id (optional)
  session_id (optional)
  order_id (optional)
  item_id (optional)

  // Who
  performed_by: staff_id | "guest" | "system"
  staff_name: string
  staff_role: string

  // Details
  description: string
  details: JSON {
    // varies by activity type
  }

  // Priority
  priority: "critical" | "urgent" | "warning" | "info" | "notice"

  // For time-based metrics
  related_activity_id (optional) // links start â†’ end events
}

Restaurant Operational Modes
Mode 1: Assigned Tables

Waiter Ram â†’ Tables 1, 2, 3

Mode 2: Open Floor (No Assignment)

Workload Indicator
System calculates workload based on:

Factor	Weight
Number of tables	Base
Occupied tables	Higher weight
Guest count	Higher weight
Active orders	Higher weight
Pending tasks	Highest weight
WORKLOAD CALCULATION:

Ram:
- 4 tables assigned
- 2 occupied (6 guests)
- 1 active order
- 0 pending tasks
= MEDIUM workload

Shyam:
- 3 tables assigned
- 1 occupied (2 guests)
- 0 active orders
- 0 pending tasks
= LOW workload
Host sees this when deciding who to assign new table.

Restaurant Seating â€” Two Situations
Situation 1: Table Available (Walk-in)
Guest arrives â†’ Table is empty â†’ Seat immediately

Guest: "Table for 4 please"
Host: "Yes sir, Table 5 is ready. Please follow me."
This is Walk-in Seating â€” guest walks in, gets seated directly.

No waiting. No reservation. Just come and sit.

Most restaurants in Nepal work this way.

Situation 2: No Table Available (Waitlist)
Guest arrives â†’ All tables occupied â†’ Guest waits

Guest: "Table for 4 please"
Host: "Sorry sir, all tables full. Wait 15 minutes?"
Guest: "Ok, we'll wait"
Host: "Your name and phone? I'll call you when ready."
This is Waitlist â€” guest waits for table to become free.

Guest waits in restaurant or outside. Host calls when table ready.

In Nepal Context
What Happens Now (Most Restaurants)
Situation: All tables full

Option 1: Guest leaves
"Tables full? Ok, we'll go somewhere else"

Option 2: Guest waits informally
Guest stands near entrance, keeps checking
No system, no name taken
First to notice empty table gets it

Option 3: Guest shares table
"Sir, can we share with another group?"
No formal waitlist system in most Nepal restaurants.

When Waitlist is Useful
For busy restaurants:

Without Waitlist	With Waitlist
Guests crowd at entrance	Organized queue
"Is table ready yet?" every 2 min	SMS notification when ready
Guests leave frustrated	Guests know their wait time
No record of who came first	Fair â€” first come first serve
Chaos during peak hours	Smooth flow

Without System (Current Nepal Style)

12:45 PM â€” Table 3 (2-seater) opens

With Waitlist System

"Sir, ~15 min wait. I'll SMS you."

12:45 PM â€” Table 3 (2-seater) opens

System shows: Ram is #1, needs 2-seater âœ“
Host calls Ram: "Sir, your table is ready"
Ram gets seated (FAIR â€” he came first)

   Guest orders online, food delivered

Some time guest order Phone Order and Takeaway Order might Dine-IN
what is the solutions

Jan 23
Good catch! Let me clarify the confusion and simplify.

The Problem
You're right â€” Phone Order and Takeaway can both become Dine-in.

Current confusion:

Phone Order â†’ Can become Dine-in âœ“
Takeaway â†’ Can also become Dine-in âœ“

So what's the difference?
Simple Difference
Phone Order	Takeaway
When ordered	In advance (call ahead)	On the spot
Where is guest	Not at restaurant yet	At counter/restaurant
Kitchen timing	Prepare for later	Prepare now
Guest waits?	No (comes when ready)	Yes (waits at counter)
Real Nepal Examples
Phone Order
Guest calls from home
"2 plate momo, 20 min ma auchu"
    â†“
Kitchen prepares (times it for 20 min)
    â†“
Guest arrives 20 min later
Food is fresh and ready
    â†“
Guest decides: Pack or Eat here
Takeaway
Guest walks into restaurant
Goes to counter
"2 plate momo pack gardinus"
    â†“
Kitchen prepares immediately
    â†“
Guest waits 10 min
    â†“
Food ready
Guest decides: Take it or Eat here
Both Can Become Dine-in!
Scenario 1: Phone Order â†’ Dine-in
Guest called: "Momo ready rakhdinus"
Guest arrives
Guest: "Yahaa nai khanchhu, ani chiya pani"
    â†“
Convert to Dine-in
Assign table
Can order more
Scenario 2: Takeaway â†’ Dine-in
Guest at counter: "Momo pack gardinus"
Food ready
Guest: "Actually yahaa nai khanchhu"
    â†“
Convert to Dine-in
Assign table
Can order more
Same outcome â€” just different starting point!

1. ORDER SOURCE (Where order came from)

  customer_name (optional)
  customer_phone (optional)

  // Timing

  // Dining choice

  choice_confirmed_at

  // Table (if dine-in)
  table_id (optional)
  session_id (optional)

  // Items
  items: [...]

  // Status
  status: "pending" | "preparing" | "ready" |
          "served" | "packed" | "completed" | "cancelled"

  // Billing
  subtotal
  packing_charge (if takeaway)
  total
  payment_status
}

Staff Data Structure
Staff {
  id

  // Personal
  name
  phone
  email
  address
  date_of_birth
  gender
  photo_url

  // Employment
  role: "owner" | "manager" | "host" | "waiter" |
        "cashier" | "kitchen" | "bar" | "cleaning"
  employment_type: "full_time" | "part_time"
  start_date
  status: "active" | "inactive" | "terminated"

  // Role-specific
  station (for kitchen): "all" | "steam" | "wok" | "grill" | "curry"

  // Login
  username
  pin_hash

  // Salary
  salary_type: "monthly" | "daily" | "hourly"
  salary_amount

  // Timestamps
  created_at
  updated_at
}

Shift {
  id
  staff_id
  date

  // Timing
  scheduled_start
  scheduled_end

  // Actual
  clock_in_at
  clock_out_at

  // Break
  break_start_at
  break_end_at
  break_duration

  // Calculated
  hours_worked
  overtime_hours

  // Status
  status: "scheduled" | "in_progress" | "completed" | "absent"

  notes
}

Attendance {
  id
  staff_id
  shift_id
  date

  clock_in_at
  clock_out_at

  is_late: boolean
  late_minutes

  is_early_out: boolean
  early_out_minutes

  breaks: [
    { start_at, end_at, duration }
  ]

  total_hours
  overtime_hours

  notes
}

StaffPerformance {
  id
  staff_id
  period: "daily" | "weekly" | "monthly"
  period_date

  // Waiter metrics
  tables_served
  guests_served
  orders_handled
  revenue_generated
  avg_response_time
  issues_count

  // Kitchen metrics
  items_prepared
  avg_prep_time
  on_time_percentage
  delays_count

  // Cleaning metrics
  tables_cleaned
  avg_cleaning_time

  // Rating
  rating

  created_at
}

Biometric Integration for Staff Attendance
Linking biometric devices (fingerprint/face) for clock in/out.

Biometric Options
Type	Device	Connection	Cost
Fingerprint	ZKTeco, eSSL, Realand	LAN/USB	Rs. 8,000 - 25,000
Face Recognition	ZKTeco, Hikvision	LAN/WiFi	Rs. 15,000 - 50,000
Card + Fingerprint	Combo devices	LAN	Rs. 12,000 - 30,000
Common in Nepal: ZKTeco, eSSL (Time Track)

StaffBiometric {

  fingerprint_template_2: binary (backup finger)

}

BiometricLog {

  device_id
  biometric_id: "001"
  staff_id (mapped)

  punch_time: timestamp
  punch_type: "in" | "out"
  verify_type: "fingerprint" | "face" | "card" | "password"

  // Sync info
  synced_at

  // Processing
  processed: boolean
  attendance_id (linked to Attendance record)
}

BiometricSyncLog {
  id
  device_id

  sync_started_at
  sync_completed_at

  status: "success" | "failed" | "partial"
  records_fetched: number
  records_processed: number

}
API Endpoints â€” Biometric
BIOMETRIC API ENDPOINTS:

# Devices
GET    /api/biometric/devices           # List all devices
POST   /api/biometric/devices           # Add new device
GET    /api/biometric/devices/:id       # Get device details
PUT    /api/biometric/devices/:id       # Update device
DELETE /api/biometric/devices/:id       # Remove device
POST   /api/biometric/devices/:id/test  # Test connection
POST   /api/biometric/devices/:id/sync  # Manual sync

# Enrollment
GET    /api/biometric/enrollment        # List staff enrollment status
POST   /api/biometric/enrollment/:staff_id  # Enroll staff
DELETE /api/biometric/enrollment/:staff_id  # Delete enrollment
POST   /api/biometric/enrollment/:staff_id/sync  # Sync to all devices

# Push endpoint (for device callbacks)
POST   /api/biometric/push              # Receive punch data from device

# Logs
GET    /api/biometric/logs              # Get biometric logs
GET    /api/biometric/sync-logs         # Get sync history
Sample Integration Code (Python)
python
# Using pyzk library for ZKTeco devices

from zk import ZK

class BiometricService:
    def __init__(self, ip, port=4370, password=0):
        self.ip = ip
        self.port = port
        self.password = password
        self.zk = ZK(ip, port=port, password=password)

    def connect(self):
        """Connect to device"""
        conn = self.zk.connect()
        return conn

    def disconnect(self):
        """Disconnect from device"""
        self.zk.disconnect()

    def get_device_info(self):
        """Get device information"""
        conn = self.connect()
        info = {
            'serial': conn.get_serialnumber(),
            'firmware': conn.get_firmware_version(),
            'users': conn.get_users(),
            'capacity': conn.get_fp_capacity()
        }
        self.disconnect()
        return info

    def get_attendance(self, start_date=None):
        """Fetch attendance logs from device"""
        conn = self.connect()
        attendance = conn.get_attendance()
        self.disconnect()

        logs = []
        for record in attendance:
            logs.append({
                'user_id': record.user_id,
                'timestamp': record.timestamp,
                'punch': record.punch,  # 0=in, 1=out
                'status': record.status
            })
        return logs

    def enroll_user(self, user_id, name):
        """Add user to device for enrollment"""
        conn = self.connect()
        conn.set_user(uid=int(user_id), name=name, user_id=user_id)
        # Staff then enrolls fingerprint at device
        self.disconnect()

    def delete_user(self, user_id):
        """Remove user from device"""
        conn = self.connect()
        conn.delete_user(uid=int(user_id))
        self.disconnect()

    def clear_attendance(self):
        """Clear attendance logs from device"""
        conn = self.connect()
        conn.clear_attendance()
        self.disconnect()


# Sync service
class BiometricSyncService:
    def sync_attendance(self, device_id):
        """Sync attendance from device to QR Dine"""
        device = get_device(device_id)
        bio_service = BiometricService(device.ip, device.port)

        # Get logs from device
        logs = bio_service.get_attendance()

        for log in logs:
            # Map biometric_id to staff_id
            staff = get_staff_by_biometric_id(log['user_id'])

            if staff:
                # Create attendance record
                create_attendance(
                    staff_id=staff.id,
                    clock_time=log['timestamp'],
                    punch_type='in' if log['punch'] == 0 else 'out',
                    source='biometric',
                    device_id=device_id
                )

        # Clear device logs after sync (optional)
        # bio_service.clear_attendance()

        return len(logs)

Data Structure â€” Cashier/Billing
Bill {
  id
  bill_number: "B-1052"
  receipt_number: "R-2026012310052"

  // Source
  type: "dine_in" | "takeaway" | "phone_order" | "counter"
  table_id
  session_id
  order_ids: []

  // Guest
  guest_count
  customer_name (optional)
  customer_phone (optional)

  // Items
  items: [
    { item_id, name, quantity, unit_price, total, notes }
  ]

  // Calculations
  subtotal
  discount_amount
  discount_percentage
  discount_reason
  discount_approved_by
  service_charge
  service_charge_percentage
  vat_amount
  vat_percentage
  packing_charge
  total

  // Rounding
  round_off
  final_total

  // Timestamps
  created_at
  printed_at
  paid_at

  // Staff
  waiter_id
  cashier_id

  // Status
  status: "pending" | "printed" | "paid" | "refunded" | "voided"
}

Payment {
  id
  bill_id

  method: "cash" | "card" | "qr" | "split"

  // For cash
  amount_received
  change_given

  // For card
  card_type: "visa" | "mastercard" | "unionpay" | "other"
  card_last_four
  reference_number
  terminal_id

  // For QR
  qr_provider: "fonepay" | "esewa" | "khalti" | "connectips"
  transaction_id

  // For split
  split_payments: [
    { method, amount, details }
  ]

  amount
  tip_amount

  paid_at
  cashier_id
}

CashDrawer {
  id
  date
  shift_id
  cashier_id

  // Opening
  opening_balance
  opened_at
  opened_by

  // Movements
  cash_sales: calculated
  cash_in_total
  cash_out_total

  // Closing
  expected_balance: calculated
  counted_balance
  difference
  closing_balance (for next day)

  closed_at
  closed_by

  status: "open" | "closed"
}

CashMovement {
  id
  drawer_id

  type: "opening" | "sale" | "cash_in" | "cash_out" | "refund" | "closing"

  amount
  reason
  notes
  reference_id (bill_id for sales)

  approved_by (for cash_out)
  created_at
  created_by
}

Refund {
  id
  bill_id
  payment_id

  type: "full" | "partial"

  items_refunded: [
    { item_id, quantity, amount }
  ]

  refund_amount
  refund_method: "same_as_original" | "cash" | "store_credit"

  reason
  notes

  approved_by
  processed_by
  processed_at
}

DrawerCount {
  id
  drawer_id

  denominations: {
    "1000": count,
    "500": count,
    "100": count,
    "50": count,
    "20": count,
    "10": count,
    "5": count,
    "2": count,
    "1": count
  }

  total_counted
  expected
  difference

  notes (if difference)

  counted_by
  counted_at
}

Multiple fake sessions	OTP changes, only real guests know

Data Structure â€” OTP
TableOTP {
  id
  table_id

  otp_code: "472"  // 3 digits

  created_at
  expires_at

  status: "active" | "verified" | "expired"

  verified_at
  verified_by_session_id
}

OTPVerificationAttempt {
  id
  table_id

  entered_code: "123"
  correct_code: "472"

  is_correct: boolean

  device_info: {
    user_agent
    ip_address
  }

  attempt_at
}

OTPSettings {
  enabled: boolean

  otp_length: 3

  expiry_mode: "time_based" | "per_session" | "daily"
  expiry_minutes: 15  // for time_based

  max_attempts: 3
  lockout_minutes: 2

  notify_waiter_on_failure: boolean
  allow_waiter_bypass: boolean
  skip_for_returning_device: boolean
}

Updated Data Structure
TableOTP {
  id
  table_id

  otp_code: "836"           // 3 digits

  status: "fresh" | "verified" | "expired"

  // Fresh = ready for new guest
  // Verified = session started with this OTP
  // Expired = session ended, waiting for cleaning

  created_at               // When OTP was generated
  verified_at              // When guest verified
  expired_at               // When session ended

  session_id               // Session that used this OTP

  generated_after_cleaning_id  // Which cleaning triggered this OTP
}

TableCleaning {
  id
  table_id

  session_id              // Previous session

  started_at
  completed_at
  duration_minutes

  cleaned_by              // Staff ID

  checklist: {
    table_wiped: boolean
    chairs_arranged: boolean
    cutlery_placed: boolean
    menu_stand_placed: boolean
  }

  new_otp_generated: "836"  // OTP created after cleaning
}

Summary â€” OTP Reset After Cleaning
Scenario	OTP Behavior
Table cleaned	âœ… NEW OTP generated
Guest verifies OTP	OTP marked "verified", locked
Session active	Same OTP, cannot re-verify
Session ends (payment)	OTP marked "expired"
Before cleaning	Old OTP invalid, new guests cannot use
Manual refresh by staff	âœ… NEW OTP generated
Benefits
Security	Each guest gets unique code
Fraud prevention	Old QR photos won't work
Simple	Cleaner triggers reset naturally
Accountability	OTP tied to cleaning event
Flow updated:

Session ends â†’ Table needs cleaning â†’ Cleaner cleans â†’ NEW OTP â†’ Next guest verifies â†’ Session starts

    { addon_id, name: "Pepperoni", price: 100 }
  ]

  // Calculated
  base_price: 850        // From size variant
  addons_price: 340      // 100 + 80 + 60 + 100
  unit_price: 1190       // base + addons

  quantity: 1
  total_price: 1190      // unit_price Ã— quantity

  special_instructions: "Extra crispy please"

Price Calculation Logic
javascript
function calculateItemPrice(menuItem, selectedOptions) {
  let price = 0;

  // 1. Get base price from required variant (e.g., Size)
  for (const group of menuItem.variant_groups) {
    if (group.required) {
      const selected = selectedOptions.variants[group.id];
      if (selected && selected.price_type === 'absolute') {
        price = selected.price;
        break;
      }
    }
  }

  // 2. Add variant add-ons (e.g., Crust Type)
  for (const group of menuItem.variant_groups) {
    if (!group.required) {
      const selected = selectedOptions.variants[group.id];
      if (selected && selected.price_type === 'addon') {
        price += selected.price;
      }
    }
  }

  // 3. Add selected toppings/add-ons
  for (const addon of selectedOptions.addons) {
    price += addon.price;  // Can be negative for discounts
  }

  // 4. Multiply by quantity
  return price * selectedOptions.quantity;
}

// Example:
// Large Pizza (850) + Cheese Burst (100) + Extra Cheese (80)
// + Mushrooms (60) + Pepperoni (100) = Rs. 1,190

Verification Flow Logic
javascript
// Customer login flow
async function handleCustomerLogin(phone, deviceFingerprint) {

  const customer = await findCustomerByPhone(phone);

  if (!customer) {
    return { action: "REGISTER_NEW" };
  }

  // Check if device is trusted
  const trustedDevice = customer.trusted_devices.find(
    d => d.device_fingerprint === deviceFingerprint &&
         d.is_active &&
         d.trusted_until > now()
  );

  if (trustedDevice) {
    // Same device - auto login
    await updateLastSeen(trustedDevice);
    return { action: "AUTO_LOGIN", customer };
  }

  // Different device - require MPIN
  return { action: "REQUIRE_MPIN", customer };
}

// New customer registration verification
async function verifyNewCustomer(phone, method) {

  const settings = await getSMSSettings();

  if (method === "sms_otp" && settings.provider) {
    // SMS OTP verification
    const otp = generateOTP(settings.otp_length);
    await sendSMS(phone, formatOTPMessage(otp));
    return { action: "ENTER_OTP", otp_sent: true };

  } else {
    // Staff verification
    const verificationCode = generateVerificationCode();
    await createPendingVerification(phone, verificationCode);
    return { action: "WAIT_STAFF", verification_code: verificationCode };
  }
}

// Device fingerprinting (simplified)
function generateDeviceFingerprint() {
  return hash({
    userAgent: navigator.userAgent,
    language: navigator.language,
    platform: navigator.platform,
    screenResolution: `${screen.width}x${screen.height}`,
    timezone: Intl.DateTimeFormat().resolvedOptions().timeZone,
    // Add more factors for uniqueness
  });
}

Points Calculation Formula
javascript
function calculatePointsForItem(item, selectedOptions, customer) {

  // Get base price from selection
  let itemPrice = getItemPrice(item, selectedOptions);

  // Base points: 1 point per Rs. 10
  let basePoints = Math.floor(itemPrice / 10);

  // Apply tier multiplier
  let multiplier = 1;
  if (customer) {
    switch(customer.tier) {
      case 'bronze':   multiplier = 1.00; break;
      case 'silver':   multiplier = 1.25; break;
      case 'gold':     multiplier = 1.50; break;
      case 'platinum': multiplier = 2.00; break;
    }
  }

  let finalPoints = Math.floor(basePoints * multiplier);

  return {
    basePoints,
    multiplier,
    finalPoints,
    displayText: customer
      ? `+${finalPoints} pts${multiplier > 1 ? ` (${multiplier}Ã—)` : ''}`
      : `Could earn ${basePoints} pts`
  };
}

// Examples:
// Rs. 350 item, Bronze â†’ 35 pts
// Rs. 350 item, Silver â†’ 44 pts (35 Ã— 1.25)
// Rs. 350 item, Gold â†’ 53 pts (35 Ã— 1.5)
// Rs. 350 item, Platinum â†’ 70 pts (35 Ã— 2)

Data Structure Updates
Session {
  id
  table_id

  // Guest count
  guest_count: 6
  guest_count_history: [
    {
      count: 4,
      set_by: "staff_id",
      set_by_type: "waiter",
      reason: null,
      set_at: "2026-01-23T17:00:00Z"
    },
    {
      count: 6,
      set_by: null,
      set_by_type: "guest",
      reason: "more_guests_arrived",
      set_at: "2026-01-23T17:15:00Z"
    }
  ]

  // Session start
  started_at
  started_by: "staff_id" | "qr_scan"
  started_by_type: "waiter" | "host" | "guest"

  // Customer
  customer_id
  customer_linked_by: "staff" | "guest" | "auto"

  // Notes
  table_notes: "Birthday celebration, cake at 7pm"

  // ... rest of fields
}

Order {
  id
  session_id
  table_id

  // Order source
  placed_by: "staff_id" | "guest"
  placed_by_type: "waiter" | "guest_qr"
  order_method: "quick_order" | "guest_qr" | "phone"

  // Items
  items: [...]
  special_instructions: "Less spicy for biryani..."

  // ... rest of fields
}

QuickOrderSettings {
  enabled: true
  allowed_roles: ["waiter", "manager"]
  show_frequent_items: true
  frequent_items_count: 10
  allow_special_instructions: true
}

GuestCountSettings {
  entry_allowed_by: ["guest", "waiter", "host", "manager"]
  update_allowed_by: ["guest", "waiter", "manager"]
  log_changes: true
  require_reason_for_update: false
}

B	I want to sell this to multiple restaurants (SaaS business)

How should multiple restaurants be separated?

Option	Description	Example
A	Subdomain per restaurant	lumora.qrdine.com, foodland.qrdine.com
B	Path per restaurant	qrdine.com/lumora, qrdine.com/foodland

Question 6.3: Data Isolation
How should restaurant data be separated?

Option	Description	Pros	Cons
A	Single database, tenant_id column	Easy to manage, cheaper	Data leak risk if bug
B	Separate schema per restaurant	Better isolation	More complex
C	Separate database per restaurant	Complete isolation	Most expensive, complex

Restaurant Owner	Full access	Access to their restaurant only
Manager	Delegated access	Delegated by owner

Feature Flags System
typescript
// How features are controlled by license

const FEATURE_FLAGS = {
  // Core (all tiers)
  qr_ordering: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  table_management: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  basic_reports: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Professional+
  loyalty_program: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  promotions: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  sms_integration: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  advanced_reports: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  inventory: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Enterprise+
  multi_location: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],
  api_access: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],
  custom_branding: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Unlimited only
  white_label: ["unlimited"],
  source_code: ["unlimited"],
};

// Check if feature is enabled
function isFeatureEnabled(feature: string, license: License): boolean {
  const allowedTiers = FEATURE_FLAGS[feature];
  return allowedTiers.includes(license.tier);
}

// Usage in code
if (isFeatureEnabled("loyalty_program", currentLicense)) {
  // Show loyalty features
} else {
  // Show "Upgrade to unlock" message
}

```
## Updated Architecture Decisions

Based on your answers, here's the final architecture:

| Decision | Choice | Reason |
|----------|--------|--------|
| **Database** | Separate schema per restaurant | Good isolation, manageable |
| **Multi-tenant** | Yes, with restaurant_id | Support SaaS model |
| **License System** | Yes, with feature flags | Support self-hosted sales |
| **Super Admin** | Yes | Manage all restaurants, licenses |
| **Deployment** | Vercel + Self-hosted option | Flexibility |
| **CodeCanyon** | Standalone mode | One-time purchase version |
```

Core Tables:
prisma
// packages/database/prisma/schema.prisma

// License & Multi-tenant
model License {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  license_key       String   @unique
  tier              LicenseTier
  status            LicenseStatus
  max_restaurants   Int      @default(1)
  features          Json     // Feature flags
  activated_at      DateTime?
  expires_at        DateTime?

  restaurants       Restaurant[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

model Restaurant {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  license_id        String
  license           License  @relation(fields: [license_id], references: [id])

  name              String
  slug              String   @unique
  logo_url          String?

  address           String?
  phone             String?
  email             String?

  currency          String   @default("NPR")
  timezone          String   @default("Asia/Kathmandu")

  settings          Json     @default("{}")

  status            RestaurantStatus @default(ACTIVE)

  // Relations
  users             User[]
  tables            Table[]
  categories        Category[]
  menu_items        MenuItem[]
  orders            Order[]
  customers         Customer[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

model User {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])

  email             String
  password_hash     String
  name              String
  phone             String?
  avatar_url        String?

  role              UserRole
  permissions       Json     @default("[]")

  pin               String?  // 4-digit PIN for quick login

  status            UserStatus @default(ACTIVE)
  last_login_at     DateTime?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, email])
}

model Table {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])

  table_number      String
  name              String?  // "Window Seat", "VIP Room"
  capacity          Int      @default(4)
  floor             String?
  section           String?

  qr_code           String   @unique
  current_otp       String?
  otp_generated_at  DateTime?

  status            TableStatus @default(AVAILABLE)

  // Current session
  current_session   TableSession? @relation("CurrentSession")

  sessions          TableSession[]

  position_x        Int?     // For floor plan
  position_y        Int?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, table_number])
}

// Enums
enum LicenseTier {
  STARTER
  PROFESSIONAL
  ENTERPRISE
  UNLIMITED
}

enum LicenseStatus {
  ACTIVE
  EXPIRED
  SUSPENDED
  CANCELLED
}

enum RestaurantStatus {
  ACTIVE
  INACTIVE
  SUSPENDED
}

enum UserRole {
  SUPER_ADMIN    // Your admin (manages all)
  OWNER          // Restaurant owner
  MANAGER
  CASHIER
  WAITER
  KITCHEN
  HOST
}

enum UserStatus {
  ACTIVE
  INACTIVE
  SUSPENDED
}

enum TableStatus {
  AVAILABLE      // Green - Ready for guests
  OCCUPIED       // Blue - Guests seated
  RESERVED       // Purple - Upcoming reservation
  CLEANING       // Yellow - Being cleaned
  BLOCKED        // Red - Not available
}

 Setup Prisma in packages/database
 Create core schema (License, Restaurant, User, Table)
 Define all enums
 Setup database connection
 Create initial migration
 Generate Prisma client
 Create seed script for test data

Tables:
prisma
// Menu System
model Category {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])

  name              String
  name_local        String?  // Nepali name
  description       String?
  image_url         String?

  sort_order        Int      @default(0)
  is_active         Boolean  @default(true)

  menu_items        MenuItem[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, name])
}

model MenuItem {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])
  category_id       String
  category          Category @relation(fields: [category_id], references: [id])

  name              String
  name_local        String?
  description       String?

  image_url         String?
  thumbnail_url     String?

  // Pricing
  pricing_type      PricingType @default(SINGLE)
  base_price        Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // For variant pricing
  variant_groups    Json?    // [{name, options: [{name, price}]}]
  addons            Json?    // [{name, price}]

  // Properties
  is_vegetarian     Boolean  @default(false)
  is_vegan          Boolean  @default(false)
  spice_level       Int?     // 0-5
  allergens         String[] @default([])

  // Availability
  is_available      Boolean  @default(true)
  available_from    String?  // "11:00"
  available_until   String?  // "22:00"
  available_days    String[] @default(["mon","tue","wed","thu","fri","sat","sun"])

  // Kitchen
  prep_time_minutes Int      @default(15)
  kitchen_station   String?  // "hot", "cold", "bar"

  // Tracking
  sort_order        Int      @default(0)
  is_popular        Boolean  @default(false)
  is_new            Boolean  @default(false)

  // Stats
  times_ordered     Int      @default(0)

  order_items       OrderItem[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

// Table Session (Dining session)
model TableSession {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  table_id          String
  table             Table    @relation(fields: [table_id], references: [id])

  // Current session link
  current_table     Table?   @relation("CurrentSession", fields: [table_id], references: [id])

  guest_count       Int
  customer_id       String?
  customer          Customer? @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])

  // Verification
  otp_code          String
  otp_verified      Boolean  @default(false)
  otp_verified_at   DateTime?

  // Status tracking
  status            SessionStatus @default(ACTIVE)

  // Staff
  started_by        String?  // User ID (staff who started)
  started_by_type   String?  // "staff" | "qr_scan"
  waiter_id         String?

  // Timestamps
  started_at        DateTime @default(now())
  ended_at          DateTime?

  // Notes
  notes             String?

  orders            Order[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

// Orders
model Order {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])

  order_number      String   // "ORD-0001"

  session_id        String?
  session           TableSession? @relation(fields: [session_id], references: [id])

  table_id          String?
  customer_id       String?
  customer          Customer? @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])

  // Order source
  order_type        OrderType @default(DINE_IN)
  order_source      OrderSource @default(QR)

  // Status
  status            OrderStatus @default(PENDING)

  // For hybrid flow - staff confirmation
  requires_confirmation Boolean @default(false)
  confirmed_at      DateTime?
  confirmed_by      String?
  rejected_at       DateTime?
  rejected_by       String?
  rejection_reason  String?

  // Items
  items             OrderItem[]

  // Pricing
  subtotal          Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  discount_amount   Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)
  tax_amount        Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)
  service_charge    Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)
  total_amount      Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // Promotions
  promo_code        String?
  promotion_id      String?

  // Points
  points_earned     Int      @default(0)
  points_redeemed   Int      @default(0)

  // Instructions
  special_instructions String?

  // Timestamps
  placed_at         DateTime @default(now())
  preparing_at      DateTime?
  ready_at          DateTime?
  served_at         DateTime?
  completed_at      DateTime?
  cancelled_at      DateTime?

  // Staff
  placed_by         String?  // Staff ID if staff placed
  served_by         String?

  bill              Bill?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, order_number])
}

model OrderItem {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  order_id          String
  order             Order    @relation(fields: [order_id], references: [id])

  menu_item_id      String
  menu_item         MenuItem @relation(fields: [menu_item_id], references: [id])

  quantity          Int
  unit_price        Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  total_price       Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // Variants & addons selected
  selected_variants Json?    // [{group, option, price}]
  selected_addons   Json?    // [{name, price}]

  // Status
  status            OrderItemStatus @default(PENDING)

  // Kitchen
  kitchen_station   String?
  sent_to_kitchen_at DateTime?
  preparing_at      DateTime?
  ready_at          DateTime?
  served_at         DateTime?

  // Notes
  special_requests  String?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

// Billing
model Bill {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String

  bill_number       String   // "BILL-0001"

  order_id          String   @unique
  order             Order    @relation(fields: [order_id], references: [id])

  session_id        String?
  customer_id       String?

  // Amounts
  subtotal          Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  discount_amount   Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)
  tax_amount        Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  service_charge    Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  total_amount      Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // Payment
  payment_status    PaymentStatus @default(PENDING)
  payment_method    PaymentMethod?

  // Split payment
  payments          Payment[]

  // Points
  points_earned     Int      @default(0)
  points_redeemed   Int      @default(0)
  points_discount   Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)

  // Status
  status            BillStatus @default(OPEN)

  // Staff
  generated_by      String?
  settled_by        String?

  generated_at      DateTime @default(now())
  settled_at        DateTime?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, bill_number])
}

model Payment {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  bill_id           String
  bill              Bill     @relation(fields: [bill_id], references: [id])

  amount            Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  method            PaymentMethod

  // For card/digital
  transaction_id    String?
  reference         String?

  // For cash
  cash_received     Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  change_given      Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  status            PaymentStatus @default(COMPLETED)

  processed_by      String?
  processed_at      DateTime @default(now())

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
}

// Enums
enum PricingType {
  SINGLE
  VARIANTS
}

enum SessionStatus {
  ACTIVE
  COMPLETED
  CANCELLED
}

enum OrderType {
  DINE_IN
  TAKEAWAY
  DELIVERY
  PHONE
}

enum OrderSource {
  QR
  STAFF
  PHONE
  ONLINE
}

enum OrderStatus {
  PENDING              // Just placed, waiting confirmation
  PENDING_CONFIRMATION // Hybrid flow - waiting staff
  CONFIRMED            // Staff confirmed
  PREPARING            // Kitchen working
  READY                // Ready to serve
  SERVED               // Delivered to table
  COMPLETED            // Fully done
  CANCELLED            // Cancelled
}

enum OrderItemStatus {
  PENDING
  SENT_TO_KITCHEN
  PREPARING
  READY
  SERVED
  CANCELLED
}

enum BillStatus {
  OPEN
  PARTIALLY_PAID
  PAID
  REFUNDED
  CANCELLED
}

enum PaymentStatus {
  PENDING
  COMPLETED
  FAILED
  REFUNDED
}

enum PaymentMethod {
  CASH
  CARD
  QR_PAYMENT
  ESEWA
  KHALTI
  FONEPAY
  POINTS
}

// Customer & Loyalty
model Customer {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  restaurant        Restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])

  customer_id       String   // "CUST-0001"

  // Basic info
  name              String
  phone             String
  email             String?
  date_of_birth     DateTime?

  // Authentication
  phone_verified    Boolean  @default(false)
  mpin_hash         String?
  mpin_attempts     Int      @default(0)
  mpin_locked_until DateTime?

  // Verification
  verification_method String? // "staff" | "sms_otp"
  verified_at       DateTime?
  verified_by       String?

  // Loyalty
  tier              CustomerTier @default(BRONZE)
  points_balance    Int      @default(0)
  points_earned_lifetime Int @default(0)
  points_redeemed_lifetime Int @default(0)

  // Spending (hidden from customer)
  total_spent       Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)
  total_visits      Int      @default(0)
  average_order_value Decimal @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)

  // Preferences
  favorite_items    String[] @default([])
  dietary_preferences String[] @default([])
  allergies         String[] @default([])

  // Communication
  sms_opt_in        Boolean  @default(true)
  email_opt_in      Boolean  @default(true)

  // Status
  status            CustomerStatus @default(ACTIVE)

  // Trusted devices
  trusted_devices   CustomerDevice[]

  // History
  sessions          TableSession[]
  orders            Order[]
  points_transactions PointsTransaction[]

  // Notes (staff only)
  notes             CustomerNote[]

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, phone])
  @@unique([restaurant_id, customer_id])
}

model CustomerDevice {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  customer_id       String
  customer          Customer @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])

  device_fingerprint String
  device_info       Json?

  trusted_until     DateTime
  is_active         Boolean  @default(true)

  first_seen_at     DateTime @default(now())
  last_seen_at      DateTime @default(now())

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
}

model CustomerNote {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  customer_id       String
  customer          Customer @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])

  note              String
  added_by          String   // User ID

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
}

model PointsTransaction {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  customer_id       String
  customer          Customer @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])

  type              PointsTransactionType
  points            Int      // Positive for earn, negative for redeem
  balance_after     Int

  // For earn
  order_id          String?
  order_amount      Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  multiplier        Decimal? @db.Decimal(3, 2)

  // For redeem
  bill_id           String?
  discount_amount   Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // For bonus
  bonus_type        String?  // "welcome", "birthday", "referral"

  // For adjustment
  reason            String?
  adjusted_by       String?

  // Expiry
  expires_at        DateTime?
  expired           Boolean  @default(false)

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
}

// Promotions
model Promotion {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String

  name              String
  description       String?
  internal_note     String?

  type              PromotionType

  // Discount
  discount_type     DiscountType
  discount_value    Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  max_discount      Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // Applies to
  applies_to        String   @default("all") // "all", "categories", "items"
  category_ids      String[] @default([])
  item_ids          String[] @default([])

  // For combo
  combo_items       Json?
  combo_price       Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // For BOGO
  bogo_buy_quantity Int?
  bogo_get_quantity Int?
  bogo_get_discount Decimal? @db.Decimal(5, 2) // percentage
  bogo_same_item    Boolean  @default(true)
  bogo_get_items    String[] @default([])

  // For promo code
  promo_code        String?

  // For min order
  min_order_tiers   Json?

  // Conditions
  min_order_amount  Decimal? @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  // Schedule
  start_date        DateTime?
  end_date          DateTime?
  days_of_week      String[] @default(["mon","tue","wed","thu","fri","sat","sun"])
  start_time        String?
  end_time          String?

  // Limits
  total_uses_limit  Int?
  total_uses_count  Int      @default(0)
  per_customer_limit Int?

  // Eligibility
  customer_eligibility String @default("all")
  eligible_tiers    String[] @default([])

  // Display
  show_on_menu      Boolean  @default(true)
  show_countdown    Boolean  @default(false)
  banner_message    String?
  banner_image_url  String?

  // Status
  status            PromotionStatus @default(ACTIVE)

  // Stats
  times_used        Int      @default(0)
  total_discount_given Decimal @db.Decimal(10, 2) @default(0)

  usages            PromotionUsage[]

  created_by        String?
  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt

  @@unique([restaurant_id, promo_code])
}

model PromotionUsage {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  promotion_id      String
  promotion         Promotion @relation(fields: [promotion_id], references: [id])

  order_id          String
  customer_id       String?

  discount_amount   Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  original_amount   Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)
  final_amount      Decimal  @db.Decimal(10, 2)

  used_at           DateTime @default(now())
}

// Enums
enum CustomerTier {
  BRONZE
  SILVER
  GOLD
  PLATINUM
}

enum CustomerStatus {
  ACTIVE
  INACTIVE
  BLOCKED
}

enum PointsTransactionType {
  EARN
  REDEEM
  BONUS
  EXPIRE
  ADJUST
}

enum PromotionType {
  HAPPY_HOUR
  COMBO
  BOGO
  FIRST_ORDER
  PROMO_CODE
  MIN_ORDER
  FESTIVAL
  ITEM_DISCOUNT
  LOYALTY_BONUS
}

enum DiscountType {
  PERCENTAGE
  FIXED
  FREE_ITEM
}

enum PromotionStatus {
  DRAFT
  ACTIVE
  PAUSED
  SCHEDULED
  EXPIRED
}

// Staff Management
model StaffShift {

  user_id           String

  shift_date        DateTime @db.Date
  shift_type        String   // "morning", "afternoon", "night"

  scheduled_start   DateTime
  scheduled_end     DateTime

  actual_start      DateTime?
  actual_end        DateTime?

  clock_in_method   String?  // "pin", "biometric", "manual"
  clock_out_method  String?

  status            ShiftStatus @default(SCHEDULED)

  break_minutes     Int      @default(0)
  overtime_minutes  Int      @default(0)

  notes             String?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())
  updated_at        DateTime @updatedAt
}

model StaffAttendance {
  id                String   @id @default(cuid())
  restaurant_id     String
  user_id           String

  date              DateTime @db.Date

  clock_in          DateTime?
  clock_out         DateTime?

  clock_in_method   String?
  clock_out_method  String?

  total_hours       Decimal? @db.Decimal(4, 2)
  break_minutes     Int      @default(0)

  status            AttendanceStatus @default(PRESENT)

  approved_by       String?

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())

  @@unique([restaurant_id, user_id, date])
}

// Communication
model ChatMessage {

  chat_type         String   // "direct", "group"

  message_text      String
  attachments       Json?

  read_by           String[] @default([])

  sent_at           DateTime @default(now())

  created_at        DateTime @default(now())

model ChatGroup {

model Announcement {

model ShiftNote {

model DailyBriefing {

  expected_covers   Int?
  reservations_count Int?
  special_events    String?

  specials          Json?    // [{name, price}]
  eighty_sixed      String[] @default([]) // Out of stock items

  staff_notes       String[] @default([])
  goals             String[] @default([])
  manager_message   String?

  read_by           String[] @default([])

  published_by      String?

export function hasPermission(
  userRole: UserRole,
  permission: keyof typeof PERMISSIONS
): boolean {
  return PERMISSIONS[permission].includes(userRole);
}

typescript
// lib/api/response.ts
export function successResponse<T>(data: T, message?: string) {
  return Response.json({
    success: true,
    message,
    data,
  });
}

export function errorResponse(message: string, status: number = 400) {
  return Response.json({
    success: false,
    message,
    data: null,
  }, { status });
}

// lib/api/middleware.ts
export function withAuth(handler: Handler, permissions?: string[]) {
  return async (req: Request, context: Context) => {
    const session = await getSession(req);

    if (!session) {
      return errorResponse('Unauthorized', 401);
    }

    if (permissions && !hasAnyPermission(session.user.role, permissions)) {
      return errorResponse('Forbidden', 403);
    }

    return handler(req, context, session);
  };
}

// lib/api/validation.ts
export function validateBody<T>(schema: ZodSchema<T>, body: unknown): T {
  const result = schema.safeParse(body);
  if (!result.success) {
    throw new ValidationError(result.error.errors);
  }
  return result.data;
}

# QR DINE - Complete System Specification

> **IMPORTANT**: This document contains ALL decisions and specifications for QR DINE.
> Any AI assistant working on this project MUST follow this specification exactly.

---

## 1. PROJECT OVERVIEW

### Basic Information
- **Project Name**: QR DINE
- **Company**: LUMORA
- **Developer**: Santosh
- **Type**: Restaurant Management & QR Ordering System

### Business Model (3 Revenue Streams)
1. **SaaS** - Hosted by LUMORA, monthly subscription
2. **CodeCanyon** - One-time purchase, buyer self-hosts
3. **Licensed Self-hosted** - Customer installs on their PC, license validates features

### License Tiers
| Tier | Price (One-time) | Price (Monthly) | Restaurants | Features |
|------|------------------|-----------------|-------------|----------|
| Starter | Rs. 15,000 | Rs. 1,500 | 1 | Basic (no loyalty, no promos) |
| Professional | Rs. 35,000 | Rs. 3,000 | 1 | Full features |
| Enterprise | Rs. 75,000 | Rs. 6,000 | 5 | All + multi-location |
| Unlimited | Rs. 150,000 | Lifetime | Unlimited | All + white-label + source |

## 3. USER ROLES & PERMISSIONS

### Roles
| Role | Description |
|------|-------------|
| SUPER_ADMIN | LUMORA admin (manages all restaurants) |
| OWNER | Restaurant owner (full access to their restaurant) |
| MANAGER | Restaurant manager (most permissions) |
| CASHIER | Billing and payments |
| WAITER | Tables, orders, customers |
| KITCHEN | Kitchen orders only |
| HOST | Tables, reservations, seating |

### Key Permission Rules
- Waiter CANNOT see bill amounts (privacy)
- Only Owner/Manager can give discounts
- Only Owner can manage staff
- Kitchen only sees their station's orders
- Customer spending data hidden from Waiter/Cashier (only Owner/Manager sees)

---

## 4. CORE FEATURES

### 4.1 Table Management
- Add/edit/delete tables
- Floor plan visual editor
- Table sections and floors
- QR code per table
- Table status: AVAILABLE, OCCUPIED, RESERVED, CLEANING, BLOCKED

### 4.2 QR Ordering Flow (Guest)
1. Guest scans QR code at table
2. Enters 3-digit OTP (displayed on table tent)
3. OTP verified â†’ Session starts
4. Guest browses menu
5. Guest adds items to cart (with variants, add-ons)
6. Guest places order
7. **If no session (guest count not set)**: Order goes to waiter for confirmation
8. **If session active**: Order goes directly to kitchen
9. Guest tracks order status
10. Guest can request bill

### 4.3 Hybrid Order Flow
- Guest can browse menu immediately after OTP verification
- Guest count is entered by STAFF ONLY (never guest)
- If staff hasn't entered guest count, order requires staff confirmation
- Staff confirms order + enters guest count â†’ Order to kitchen

### 4.4 Menu System
- Categories with images
- Menu items with:
  - Single price OR variant pricing (size: S/M/L)
  - Add-ons/toppings
  - Images (multiple)
  - Availability schedule
  - Kitchen station assignment
  - Dietary info (veg, vegan, allergens)
  - Prep time

### 4.5 Order Management
- Order status tracking
- Kitchen display system (KOT)
- Order status: PENDING â†’ CONFIRMED â†’ PREPARING â†’ READY â†’ SERVED â†’ COMPLETED

### 4.6 Billing
- Generate bill from order
- Apply discounts (manual, promo code)
- Multiple payment methods: Cash, Card, QR (eSewa, Khalti, FonePay)
- Split payments
- Points redemption
- Print bill

### 4.7 Customer Loyalty System
**Privacy Rule**: Customers see POINTS only, Owners see SPENDING data

#### Tiers (Points-based for customers)
| Tier | Customer Sees | Owner Sees | Multiplier |
|------|---------------|------------|------------|
| Bronze | Entry level | Sign up | 1Ã— |
| Silver | 500 pts earned | Rs. 5,000 spent | 1.25Ã— |
| Gold | 1,500 pts earned | Rs. 15,000 spent | 1.5Ã— |
| Platinum | 5,000 pts earned | Rs. 50,000 spent | 2Ã— |

#### Points
- Earn: 1 point per Rs. 10 spent Ã— tier multiplier
- Redeem: 1 point = Rs. 1 discount
- Display on menu items: "ğŸ’° +35 pts"

#### Verification
- Primary: Staff verification (no SMS cost)
- Optional: SMS OTP (Sparrow SMS API)
- MPIN: 4-digit PIN for returning customers
- Device trust: Same device = auto-login

### 4.8 Promotions
- Happy Hour (time-based discount)
- Combo Deals (bundle pricing)
- BOGO (buy one get one)
- Promo Codes
- Minimum Order Discount (spend Rs. 500 get 10% off)
- Festival Offers
- First Order Discount

### 4.9 Staff Management
- Staff directory
- Role assignment
- Shift scheduling
- Attendance tracking (with optional biometric)
- Performance tracking

### 4.10 Communication
- Internal chat (staff to staff)
- Announcements (manager to all)
- Shift notes (handover info)
- Daily briefing
- Lost & Found log

### 4.11 Reports
- Sales reports
- Order reports
- Customer reports
- Staff performance
- Inventory (basic)
- Export to Excel/PDF

## 5. MULTI-TENANT ARCHITECTURE

### Data Isolation
- Separate schema per restaurant (PostgreSQL schemas)
- All tables include restaurant_id
- API middleware validates restaurant access

### Super Admin Features
- Add/remove restaurants
- Manage licenses
- View all statistics
- Manage subscriptions

---

## 6. LICENSE SYSTEM

### How It Works
1. Customer installs QR DINE on their PC
2. On first run, enters LICENSE KEY
3. System validates with LUMORA license server
4. Server returns: tier, features, expiry, limits
5. Features enabled/disabled based on tier
6. Periodic re-validation (daily)

### Feature Flags
```typescript

  qr_ordering: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],

  promotions: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  sms_integration: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  multi_location: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],
  cloud_backup: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  white_label: ["unlimited"],
};
```

## 7. DESKTOP APP (ELECTRON)

### Installer Features (Like ZKTeco BioTime)

- Auto-install PostgreSQL (or use existing)

### System Tray Features

  - Enterprise: 20 GB

## 8. DATABASE SCHEMA OVERVIEW

### Core Tables
- License, Restaurant, User, Table

### Menu & Orders
- Category, MenuItem, TableSession, Order, OrderItem, Bill, Payment

### Customer & Loyalty
- Customer, CustomerDevice, PointsTransaction, Promotion, PromotionUsage

### Staff & Communication
- StaffShift, StaffAttendance, ChatMessage, Announcement, ShiftNote, DailyBriefing, LostFoundItem, ActivityLog

### Key Enums
- LicenseTier, UserRole, TableStatus, OrderStatus, CustomerTier, PromotionType, PaymentMethod

## 9. API STRUCTURE

### Public (Guest) APIs - No auth required
- POST /api/guest/verify-otp
- GET /api/guest/menu
- POST /api/guest/order
- GET /api/guest/order/[id]/status

### Protected APIs - Auth required
- /api/restaurants/*
- /api/tables/*
- /api/menu/*
- /api/orders/*
- /api/customers/*
- /api/staff/*
- /api/reports/*

### API Response Format
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Optional message",
  "data": { },
  "meta": { "page": 1, "limit": 10, "total": 100 }
}
```

---

## 10. UI/UX GUIDELINES

### Guest Interface (Mobile-first)
- Large touch targets
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Cart always visible
- Order status prominent
- Points display on menu items

### Staff Interface (Desktop-first)
- Dashboard with overview
- Quick actions
- Real-time updates
- Keyboard shortcuts for common tasks

### Nepal-specific
- Currency: NPR (Rs.)
- Language: English + Nepali (optional)
- Payment: eSewa, Khalti, FonePay integration

---

## 11. CODING CONVENTIONS

### TypeScript
- Strict mode enabled
- No `any` type
- Proper interfaces for all data
- Zod for validation

### File Naming
- Components: PascalCase (Button.tsx)
- Utilities: camelCase (formatDate.ts)
- Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE

### Database
- Table names: PascalCase (MenuItem)
- Column names: snake_case (created_at)
- Always include: id, created_at, updated_at
- Always include: restaurant_id (for multi-tenancy)

### API
- RESTful conventions
- Proper HTTP status codes
- Consistent error handling
- Input validation on all endpoints

---

## 12. IMPORTANT RULES

### NEVER DO
- Never let guest enter guest count (staff only)
- Never show spending data to waiter/cashier
- Never skip license validation in self-hosted mode
- Never expose sensitive data in API responses
- Never trust client-side data without validation

### ALWAYS DO
- Always validate restaurant_id access
- Always check permissions before actions
- Always log important activities
- Always handle errors gracefully
- Always include timestamps in database records

---

*End of Specification*

# 1. PROJECT OVERVIEW

## 1.1 Basic Information

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| Project Name | QR DINE |
| Company | LUMORA |
| Developer | Santosh |
| Type | Restaurant Management & QR Ordering System |
| Target Market | Nepal (Primary), Global (Secondary) |
| Currency | NPR (Rs.) |
| Languages | English (Primary), Nepali (Optional) |

## 1.2 System Description

QR DINE is a comprehensive restaurant management ERP system that covers:
- QR code-based ordering for guests
- Complete staff dashboards (Waiter, Kitchen, Cashier, Manager)
- Customer loyalty and CRM
- Promotions and offers
- Staff management
- Reports and analytics
- Multi-tenant SaaS capability
- Self-hosted installation option

## 1.3 Key Differentiators

1. **Hybrid Order Flow**: Guests browse immediately, staff confirms orders
2. **Privacy-Focused Loyalty**: Customers see points, owners see spending
3. **Staff-Only Guest Count**: Ensures accountability
4. **Multiple Revenue Streams**: SaaS + CodeCanyon + Licensed self-hosted
5. **Professional Installer**: Like ZKTeco BioTime (Windows)

## 5.3 Feature Flags Implementation
```typescript
// packages/utils/features.ts

export const FEATURE_FLAGS = {
  // Core (all tiers)
  qr_ordering: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  table_management: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  menu_management: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  order_management: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  basic_billing: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  basic_reports: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  local_backup: ["starter", "professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Professional+
  loyalty_program: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  promotions: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  sms_integration: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  advanced_reports: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  customer_crm: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],
  cloud_backup: ["professional", "enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Enterprise+
  multi_location: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],
  api_access: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],
  custom_branding: ["enterprise", "unlimited"],

  // Unlimited only
  white_label: ["unlimited"],
  source_code: ["unlimited"],
} as const;

export type FeatureKey = keyof typeof FEATURE_FLAGS;
export type LicenseTier = "starter" | "professional" | "enterprise" | "unlimited";

export function isFeatureEnabled(feature: FeatureKey, tier: LicenseTier): boolean {
  return FEATURE_FLAGS[feature]?.includes(tier) ?? false;
}

export function getEnabledFeatures(tier: LicenseTier): FeatureKey[] {
  return Object.keys(FEATURE_FLAGS).filter(
    (feature) => isFeatureEnabled(feature as FeatureKey, tier)
  ) as FeatureKey[];
}
```

## 5.5 License Data Structure
```typescript
interface License {
  id: string;
  license_key: string;              // "QRDINE-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX"
  tier: LicenseTier;
  status: "active" | "expired" | "suspended" | "cancelled";

  // Limits
  max_restaurants: number;
  max_staff_per_restaurant: number | null;  // null = unlimited
  max_tables_per_restaurant: number | null;
  cloud_storage_gb: number;

  // Features
  features: string[];               // Enabled feature keys

  // Validity
  activated_at: Date | null;
  expires_at: Date | null;          // null = lifetime

  // Tracking
  last_validated_at: Date;
  activation_count: number;
  max_activations: number;

  // Owner
  owner_name: string;
  owner_email: string;
  owner_phone: string;

  created_at: Date;
  updated_at: Date;
}
```

# 6. USER ROLES & PERMISSIONS

## 6.1 Role Definitions

| Role | Level | Description |
|------|-------|-------------|
| **SUPER_ADMIN** | System | LUMORA admin - manages all restaurants |
| **OWNER** | Restaurant | Restaurant owner - full access |
| **MANAGER** | Restaurant | Restaurant manager - most permissions |
| **CASHIER** | Restaurant | Handles billing and payments |
| **WAITER** | Restaurant | Tables, orders, guest service |
| **KITCHEN** | Restaurant | Kitchen orders only |
| **HOST** | Restaurant | Seating, reservations |

```typescript
export type Permission = keyof typeof PERMISSIONS;
export type UserRole = "SUPER_ADMIN" | "OWNER" | "MANAGER" | "CASHIER" | "WAITER" | "KITCHEN" | "HOST";

export function hasPermission(role: UserRole, permission: Permission): boolean {
  return PERMISSIONS[permission]?.includes(role) ?? false;
}

export function hasAnyPermission(role: UserRole, permissions: Permission[]): boolean {
  return permissions.some((permission) => hasPermission(role, permission));
}

export function hasAllPermissions(role: UserRole, permissions: Permission[]): boolean {
  return permissions.every((permission) => hasPermission(role, permission));
}
```

## 6.3 Critical Permission Rules
```
â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—
â•‘ âš ï¸  CRITICAL PERMISSION RULES - NEVER VIOLATE                                 â•‘
â• â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•£

â•‘    - Hidden: total_spent, average_order_value, lifetime_value                â•‘
â•‘                                                                               â•‘
â•‘ 3. ONLY OWNER CAN MANAGE STAFF                                                â•‘

â•‘                                                                               â•‘

â•‘                                                                               â•‘

â•‘                                                                               â•‘
```
